Function Documentation

std::auto_ptr< BitBuffer > createCustomImageSize (  const MC2String &  imagePath,
const MC2String &  filename,
bool  cropped
) 
 

This will create a PNG from a SVG, the size is determined by the filename format.

The format is: imagename_%wx%h.png Where w is the request width in pixels and h the height in pixels, and the SVG image loaded to convert this image will be called imagename.svg.

The requested size will not be affected by cropping.

Parameters:
imagePath Base path of images without the last '/'.
filename filename without the special prefix, e.g Q.
cropped Whether all side transparency should be cropped, e.g no offset transparency on either side. The requested size will not be affected by this.
Returns:
allocated bitbuffer for custom PNG image.

MC2String getFilename (  const MC2String &  filename,
int32 &  width,
int32 &  height
) 
 

Convert input filename to real filename and size, that can be converted to a valid size later.

Parameters:
height will contain height in pixels.
Returns:
final filename, if empty then the convert failed.

bool getPNGImageSize (  const MC2String &  filePath,
int32 &  width,
int32 &  height
) 
 

Try to get image width and height from a png file.

Parameters:
filePath The patch to the png file.
width Set to the width of the image.
height Set to the height of the image.
Returns:
True if width and height are set.

bool magnify (  const MC2String &  origName,
const MC2String &  destName,
uint32  factor,
bool  cropped
) 
 

Magnify origname file to destName by a factor.

First tries to use svg then calls ImageTools::magnify.

Parameters:
origName Original filename.
destName Destination filename.
factor The magnification factor, 2 for double original size.
cropped If to remove transparent areas of the image.
Returns:
true on success.
